content: do half this and omit the turn-up for a fitted beanie start broken rib pattern round 1 knit round 2 k1 p1 rib work these two rounds in pattern until total length is about 8 /20cm long tip you will need around 15 yards/13 5 metres of yarn to complete the decrease and finish off the hat make sure you leave enough yarn 2 decrease row tip if you are a perfectionist like me you could do the decreases using cdd = centred double decrease of slip two together knitwise k1 pass slipped sts over - or you could just do k3tog like a normal person round 1 k3tog k5 around = 60 sts round 2 k1 p1 rib round 3 knit round 4 k1 p1 rib round 5 k3tog k3 around = 40 sts round 6 k1 p1 rib round 7 knit round 8 k1 p1 rib round 9 k3tog k1 around = 20 sts round 10 k1 p1 rib round 11 k3tog around to last two sts k2tog = 7 sts thread yarn through remaining 7 sts and fasten_off weaving in ends carefully so that they don t show on either side ………………………… instructions for smaller hat although this pattern is a quite forgiving in terms of fit you may want to make a slightly smaller hat in which case cast on 64 stitches knit 2 /5cm rib brim work until 7 /18cm long and then for the decrease rounds do the following round 1 k3tog k5 around = 48 sts round 2 k1 p1 rib round 3 knit round 4 k1 p1 rib round 5 k3tog k3 around = 32 sts round 6 k1 p1 rib round 7 knit round 8 k1 p1 rib round 9 k3tog k1 around = 16 sts round 10 k1 p1 rib round 11 k3tog around to last two sts k2tog = 6 sts for an even smaller hat you could work the hat in worsted or aran yarn or even dk adjusting the length to suit 3
